text:
The conversation between P1 and P2 goes as follows:

P1: Excuse me, could you help me?
P2: Yes, what seems to be the problem?
P1: Well, I was wondering if someone had given a passport?
P2: I'm afraid that no one has. Have you lost your passport?
P1: I think so. I can't find it anywhere in my hotel room and I remember the last place where I used it was in that big department store.
P2: Where did you use your passport in the department store?
P1: In the shoe section. I had to show it to pay for these shoes with my travel checks.
P2: Well, let me call the shoe department to see if they have found a passport. Sorry, but your passport was not found there either.
P1: What should I do then?
P2: You can fill out this loss of object form and I will keep an eye open. These kinds of things usually end up reappearing, but I suggest you contact your embassy and explain your situation, so they can help you get a new passport in case it doesn't appear.
P1: You're right. Would you have a pen?
P2: Here you are.
P1: Oh, I always feel like I'm losing something every time I travel.
